summary: The Combating Lethal Elements and Narcotics in the Pacific Act of 2025 (CLEAN Pacific Act) establishes the Pacific Counternarcotics Initiative. This initiative aims to assist Pacific Island countries in counter-drug efforts, focusing on seizing and destroying listed chemicals, alleviating backlogs, and preventing the reintroduction of chemicals into drug production. It mandates an implementation plan, annual progress reports, and defines beneficiary countries and key terms. The Secretary of State, in consultation with other relevant officials, will oversee the program, utilizing existing funds for foreign assistance.
